article_title: Top 10 Form W-2, 1099 and 1095 Myths vs. Realities
article_text:
5. Independent Contractor Freedom Myth

Myth: If an employer gives a worker freedom to act, the worker should be classified as an independent contractor.



Reality: The general rule is that an individual is an independent contractor if the payer has the right to control or direct only the result of the work and not what will be done and how it will be done. An individual is an employee if the employer can control what will be done and how it will be done even if the employer gives the employee freedom of action.

article_metadata.sailthru.author: No Author
article_metadata.description: Greatland Corporation has compiled a list of misconceptions when it comes to tax-reporting requirements. Failing to understand the real truth behind these myths can cost a business extra money to file again or, even worse, to pay steep fines if reporting is not done in compliance with regulations.

article_summary:
Independent Contractor Freedom MythMyth: If an employer gives a worker freedom to act, the worker should be classified as an independent contractor.
An individual is an employee if the employer can control what will be done and how it will be done even if the employer gives the employee freedom of action.
Reality: The general rule is that an individual is an independent contractor if the payer has the right to control or direct only the result of the work and not what will be done and how it will be done.
